availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Joyce (Louisville, Kentucky, attorney and prov govt rep)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, attorney.Louisville, Kentucky, attorney. Married to Harriett Joyce. Father of John Joyce, Catherine Joyce, and Sally Joyce. Attorney in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Jefferson County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 7, p. 510.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, p. 6, p. 55 of microfilm.
